name: Lighthouse
description: Display Google Lighthouse reports and evaluate audit scores with assertions.
author: GSoft
helpMarkDown: You can provide the lighthouse NPM package, otherwise it will be installed in a temporary directory.

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: CLI arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The [CLI arguments](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/lighthouse) to pass to Lighthouse. One argument per line.

`--view`, `--output`, `--output-path`, `--chrome-flags` are prohibited and will be either removed or replaced.

inputs.name: chromeFlags
inputs.label: Chrome Flags
inputs.helpMarkDown: The [Chrome Flags](https://peter.sh/experiments/chromium-command-line-switches/) to pass to LightHouse. Set Arguments separated by space, e.g. `--disable-gpu --headless --no-sandbox`

inputs.name: assertions
inputs.label: Audit score assertions
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Allows you to write audit score assertions that can stop the pipeline if any assertion fail.

Write one assertion per line. For example:
`no-vulnerable-libraries = 1` (expects score of `no-vulnerable-libraries` to be equal to 1)
`speed-index > 0.5` (expects score of `speed-index` to be greater than 0.5)

Audit score values are always between 0 and 1.
You can find the [list of available audits here](https://github.com/gsoft-inc/azure-pipelines-lighthouse#available-audits).

inputs.name: tabName
inputs.label: Report tab name override
inputs.helpMarkDown: Overrides the default tab name that will be shown in the HTML Lighthouse result.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you already have Lighthouse installed on the agent and want to use it, specify here the path of `node_modules`'s parent directory.
